awd_titl_txt: The Beal Hornfels Deposit:  A New Type of Disseminated Gold Mineralization
awd_abstract_narration: The discovery and mining of the Beal deposit suggests that                      hornfels mineralization may become increasingly important as                    a source of gold and as an exploration target.  However,                        gold-bearing hornfels are largely unknown to the scientific                     community.  The research will first establish the                               descriptive base of alteration mineralogy and host rock                         stratigraphy.  Then, by comparing the Beal silicate and calc-                   silicate mineralogy to non-mineralized hornfels aureoles, an                    occurrence model for gold hornfels mineralization will be                       developed.  Fluid inclusion and stable isotope analyses will                    constrain the fluid source, composition, and temperature of                     the mineralizing solutions and allow formulation of an                          overall genetic model with predictive power for other                           hornfels systems.
